results.title: Thoroughly modern Millie
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Ross Hunter Productions, Ross Hunter and George Roy Hill
results.brief_description: The Roaring Twenties come to life in this Academy Award winning musical starring Julie Andrews as the naive Millie, a country girl who comes to the big city in search of a husband. She befriends the sweet Miss Dorothy played by Mary Tyler Moore, fends off white slaver Mrs. Meers (Beatrice Lillie) and meets up with Muzzy played by Carol Channing who manages to solve all of Millie’s romantic problems which involve her boss (John Gavin) and paperclip salesman James Fox.

results.title: This is the army
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Hollywood House Video, Thirtieth Cemalux, Jack L. Warner, Hal Wallis and Michael Curtiz
results.brief_description: In World War I dancer Jerry Jones stages an all-soldier show on Broadway, called Yip Yip Yaphank. Wounded in the War, he becomes a producer. In World War II his son Johnny Jones, previously his father’s assistant, gets the order to stage a new all-soldier show, called “This is the army”. But in his personal life he has problems, because he refuses to marry his fiance until the war is over. Cast includes George Murphy, Joan Leslie, George Tobias, Alan Hale, Kate Smith, and men from the armed forces including Ronald Reagan and Joe Louis. Based on the play by Irving Berlin, music and lyrics by Irving Berlin. Includes bonus blooper footage of Ronald Reagan in rehearsal. Note: “Copyright Thirtieth Cemalux Pty Ltd 1986”

results.title: This is spinal tap
results.creator_credit: Embassy Pictures Corporation (US), Karen Murphy and Rob Reiner
results.brief_description: Filmed as a documentary, this satire mimics a serious rock documentary with interviews, concert footage and glimpses of the day to day life of “Spinal Tap”. Christopher Guest, Michael McKean and Harry Shearer star as the band’s members, while Rob Reiner appears as the film maker (Marty Di Bergi). C0-starring Anjelica Huston and Billy Crystal.

results.title: This boy's life
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Regency Enterprises, Odyssey, Art Linson and Michael Caton-Jones
results.brief_description: This is the captivating true story based on the book by Tobias Wolff. Growing up is never easy but for Tobias Wolff (Leonardo DiCaprio) it’s sheer hell. His mother, Caroline (Ellen Barkin), has just married Dwight Hansen (Robert De Niro), a psychotic disciplinarian who rules with an iron fist and an explosive temper. Instead of the bright future his mother promised him, Tobias must now endure constant brutality from his sadistic stepfather. There is a way out though; and with the will to fight and courage way beyond his years, Tobias just might find it. An absorbing and thoughtful story is brought to life by the gripping performances of the stars.

results.title: Thirty two short films about Glenn Gould
results.creator_credit: Rhombus Media, Niv Fichman and Francois Girard
results.brief_description: Thirty two short films about Glenn Gould is an inventive and playful film that seeks to portray the genius, complex and eccentric personality of legendary pianist, Glenn Gould. The film borrows its structure from JS Bach’s Goldberg Variations (and name from Beethoven’s “32 variations in C Minor”), and juxtaposes 32 short vignettes to portray the broadly influenced Gould. The film uses a combination of interview, dramatisation and animation, punctuated with the music of Gould’s live performances (mostly Bach, Beethoven and Shoenberg) to humorously fill the portrait of Gould. Included is an excerpt from Norman McLaren’s experimental animation ‘Spheres’ and Gould’s live radio broadcast of 28th December 1967, ‘The Idea of North’. Peppered throughout are Gould’s philosophical ruminations such as, “for every hour you spend with people you need x more hours on your own”.

results.title: Thirty seconds over Tokyo
results.creator_credit: Mervyn LeRoy, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Sam Zimbalist
results.brief_description: Spencer Tracy, Van Johnson and Robert Mitchum in his first leading role star in this classic World War II thriller based on the real-life diary of an American pilot (Ted Lawson) who was involved in the first American air raids on Japan. Lieutenant Colonel James Doolittle (Spencer Tracy) is the tough and inspiring mastermind of the historic crew of the “Ruptured Duck”, commanded by Captain Ted Lawson (Van Johnson). Lawson’s daydreams of the bride he left behind are intertwined with the nightmarish terrors of a tense Pacific crossing, thunderous bombings and the fate of his men. This is not only an action filled, emotional, historical saga of the war in the Pacific but also a romantic tale of American patriotism at its best.

results.title: Thirteen days = Thirteen days that shocked the world
results.creator_credit: Beacon Communications, Tig Productions, Peter O Almond, Armyan Bernstein, Kevin Costner, Paul Deacon, Mary Montiforte and Roger Donaldson
results.brief_description: Based on the book “The Kennedy Tapes - inside the White House During the Cuban Missile Crisis” by Ernest R. May and Philip D. Zelikow, “Thirteen Days” is a riveting drama about one of the most significant moments in the Cold War. Set almost entirely in the White House the film examines President John Kennedy’s (Bruce Greenwood) role in the Crisis, his relationship with his brother Robert (Steven Culp) - the then Attorney General of the USA - and the crucial role played by the President’s political advisor, Kenny O’Donnell (Kevin Costner). Simply but elegantly shot by Andrzej Bartkowiak and featuring a well-researched and structured screenplay by David Self, the film approaches a near-documentary realism. Roger Donaldson’s taut direction builds a consistent tension without sacrificing the complexities of the historical drama. Undoubtedly the closest the world has come to a nuclear war, the film establishes the diplomatic and military stand-off between the USA and the USSR as the key foreign affairs event for both President Kennedy and for Soviet leader Kruschev. This film is an excellent political thriller, its impact made more chillingly frightening by our knowledge of the catastrophic consequences of one wrong, or ill-communicated, political decision.

results.title: Thirteen conversations about one thing = 13 conversations ab
results.creator_credit: Stonelock Pictures, Echo Lake Productions, Beni Atoori, Gina Resnick and Jill Sprecher
results.brief_description: What is happiness? Through the journey of the everyday, five individuals’ lives link in a way that alters their fate or outlook. Karma, hope and fate are explored in this tale set in amongst busy city dwellers all with the need to answer life’s eternal questions of ‘what is life?’, ‘what’s in it for me?’ and even ‘how do I relate to others?’ Co-written and directed by Jill Sprecher. Stellar ensemble cast includes John Turturro, Matthew McConaughey, Clea DuVall, Amy Irving, Tia Texada, Barbara Sukowa, Alan Arkin.

results.title: Things to do in Denver when you're dead
results.creator_credit: Miramax Films, Cary Woods and Gary Fleder
results.brief_description: The plot centres around a motley gang of mobsters with names like Jimmy the Saint, Pieces, Franchise, Easy Wind and Critical Bill, all who are trying to go straight but are doomed to be called back for one final job. Jimmy the Saint’s (Andy Garcia) “Afterlife Advice” business for terminally ill clients (where they can videotape future advice for their loved ones) is falling into a hole rapidly. Needing some finance Jimmy turns to his old boss The Man With The Plan (Christopher Walken) for help but in return he has to do a favour for The Man - “rough up” The Man’s son’s ex-girlfriend’s new boyfriend! Jimmy calls in the old Gang and together they hatch an elaborate plan, a plan that ends up going horribly wrong. Stars Christopher Lloyd, William Forsythe, Bill Nunn, Treat Williams, Jack Warden, Steve Buscemi, Fairuza Balk.

results.title: Things to come
results.creator_credit: London Film Productions, Alexander Korda and William Cameron Menzies
results.brief_description: Things to come is the famous film adaptation of H.G. Wells’ prophetic novel and futuristic exploration ‘The Shape of Things to Come’. Wells’ futuristic vision of impending global war (chillingly) begins at the outbreak of World War II in 1940. The film shifts to the mid 1960’s to Everytown, a place in ruins ruled by a makeshift warlord on the brink of insanity. The film’s closing act begins in 2036 Everytown, at a time of peace but also uninspiring technological Utopia. Run by scientists the townsfolk eventually resist the directives of the scientists and rebel against their imposed staid futuristic lifestyles. With extraordinary set designs by Vincent Korda. Cast includes Raymond Massey and Ralph Richardson.
